description: From Latin hiemalis, from hiems (“winter”). Compare French hyémal.

adjectives.description: hyemal (comparative more hyemal, superlative most hyemal)

examples: But, beside vernal, æstival and autumnal, made of flowers, the ancients had also the hyemal garlands; contenting themselves at first with such as were made of horn dyed into several colours, and shaped into the figure of flowers
